label: Triumph
description: The central aim is achieved without ruinous cost, validating teamwork, preparation, and principled choices. Reputation consolidates into earned authority; internal conflicts resolve into integration rather than suppression.

label: Redemption
description: Past harms are atoned for through costly, restorative action that repairs specific damage and changes habits. Reputation is re‑negotiated, not erased; the character becomes trustworthy because they behave differently under pressure.

label: Tragic Downfall
description: Strengths curdle into vices and the fatal flaw consumes the character. The world learns from their wreckage; the character does not, and that is the tragedy.

label: Martyrdom
description: The character’s death secures others’ survival or freedom and transforms reputation into symbol. The moral is not that death is good, but that some goods outrank self‑preservation.

label: Exile
description: Cast out or self‑banished to protect others or survive, the character’s arc pivots to growth in solitude. Exile reframes belonging and often sets up a harder, wiser return.

label: Ascension
description: Raised to rulership, sainthood, or a higher order of being, the character now faces the second mountain: wielding power without corruption. The end is a beginning disguised as a coronation.

label: Hollow Victory
description: The goal is achieved but meaning is lost—broken relationships, corrupted self. It interrogates whether the motivation was worthy and whether the plan extracted an unforgivable price.

label: Pyrrhic Victory
description: Success at catastrophic cost—a city saved, a family lost. It leaves a mixed legacy and warns future leaders about the hidden denominator in “win at any cost.”

label: Bittersweet
description: Gains and losses are both real; hope survives alongside grief. The arc honors ambiguity and the maturity required to carry it.

label: Reconciliation
description: Estranged bonds are repaired through truth, apology, and changed behavior. It resolves internal shame loops and re‑anchors the character inside a chosen community.

label: Corruption
description: The character embraces darkness for power or survival and remakes their values to match. Reputation flips; former allies become obstacles, then examples.

label: Enlightenment
description: A durable clarity reorders choices and identity; the character gains insight without detachment from responsibility. The world changes because they do.

label: Imprisonment
description: Constrained physically or socially, the character’s victory becomes endurance, influence from within, or escape. Justice or injustice colors the moral.

label: Liberation
description: Chains—literal or systemic—are broken, turning criminality into catalyst in retrospect. The world’s map updates; so does the character’s sense of self.

label: Forgotten Obscurity
description: The character fades without recognition; the impact, if any, is private. It challenges glory motivations and exalts quiet fidelity.

label: Scapegoated
description: Blame is assigned to protect a system; the character bears the stain. Truth may surface later, but the human cost is already paid.

label: Crowned Ruler
description: Authority is granted or seized; destiny tests whether stewardship or ego will rule. Success depends on tempering flaws with counsel and constraint.

label: Dethroned
description: Authority is lost through coup or failure. The arc asks whether the character learns, calcifies, or becomes the thing they fought.

label: Unmasked
description: Secrets come to light and consequences land. The character’s next identity—honest or defiant—begins here.

label: Reformed
description: Habits and patterns change in visible, sustained ways. The plot proves it by presenting the old trigger and showing a different choice.

label: Ruined
description: Resources, name, or health collapse beyond repair. The character may still achieve a moral rescue, but the worldly cost is permanent.

label: Wanderer’s Return
description: The cyclical journey ends at home transformed; old rooms feel smaller because the character is larger. Acceptance—by self and by others—determines whether the change endures.

label: Founder/Teacher
description: The character builds institutions or disciples; legacy becomes the lens. The test is whether the creation stays humane when scaled.

label: Immortalized
description: The character becomes myth or symbol; biography hardens into parable. Their reputation outlives their flaws, for good or ill.

label: Bound to the Land/Charge
description: Fused to a duty or place, the character wins a sacred, limiting victory. Stewardship outranks freedom; meaning replaces mobility.

label: Doomed by Prophecy
description: Attempts to escape fate fulfill it; fatalism becomes the trap. The story warns against confusing foreknowledge with necessity.

label: Exonerated
description: False blame lifts; truth repairs reputation and reopens futures. The story reframes past endurance as integrity, not impotence.

label: Self‑Exile for Integrity
description: The character leaves to preserve principles or protect others. Reputation may dim; conscience brightens.

label: Reborn
description: Identity is remade (new name, calling, or body). The past remains fact, but it no longer rules the present.

label: Integrated
description: The character harmonizes competing values (duty and love, justice and mercy) into a workable life. It’s quieter than triumph and rarer.
